channel.title: Google Operating System
channel.description: Yeah you read that title right Google are going head to head with microsoft with a new open source operating system! It will by targeted at netbooks to start with and will be seperate from android but it sounds promising http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8139711.stm

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ChromeOS is not a new OS in the sense that yall are thinking. Its (pretty much) an os that only runs a browser, and the idea is you do everything in the cloud. Dosent appeal to me in the slightest personally.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

runescape3dude:

I would trust google a lot less as the leading manufacturer of desktop Operating Systems than Microsoft. Either way there is going to be a monopoly, either google (Will have loads of ads), or Microsoft (Slow and laggy).

Slow and laggy?
Last time I checked, Windows 7 runs great on netbooks.

Also:
http://www.engadget.com/2009/07/08/switched-on-with-google-this-is-not-your-fathers-os-war/

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:19, topic:287855”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=380554.msg2862070#msg2862070 date=1247237212]
Intel is supporting this.

I bet this will be the end of the almost monopoly of MS. Hardware manufacturers will walk over to Google. OEM manufacturers will do the same.
[/quote]

I would trust google a lot less as the leading manufacturer of desktop Operating Systems than Microsoft. Either way there is going to be a monopoly, either google (Will have loads of ads), or Microsoft (Slow and laggy).[/quote]
As long Google using Linux they can’t get full control over the OS market, you can just switch to Ubuntu or something much better and still use the same Apps and Games.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System

item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:15, topic:287855”]Intel is supporting this.

I bet this will be the end of the almost monopoly of MS. Hardware manufacturers will walk over to Google. OEM manufacturers will do the same.[/quote]

I would trust google a lot less as the leading manufacturer of desktop Operating Systems than Microsoft. Either way there is going to be a monopoly, either google (Will have loads of ads), or Microsoft (Slow and laggy).

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

If ChromeOS sticks with Linux, it will finally bring the kernel to the public/mainstream.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Intel is supporting this.

Have they officially said so? What about Moblin?
Also, http://www.engadget.com/2009/07/08/google-names-chrome-os-compatriots-dell-noticeably-absent/

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s great that it is based on linux, now software developers will have a very good reason to support linux. I’m sure, as Unhandled said, that most if not all applications that ship with this OS will be web apps, but for gaming and such apps will have to be written nativly to run on the computer, so it will still be good.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Intel is supporting this.

I bet this will be the end of the almost monopoly of MS. Hardware manufacturers will walk over to Google. OEM manufacturers will do the same.

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Man UTD Freak, post:11, topic:287855”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=380554.msg2861305#msg2861305 date=1247178967]
Will it play games?
[/quote]

I don’t think so because there is no DirectX support, is there?[/quote]
so what? you can play opengl games and vmware lets you play games in windows with hardware accel

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

runescape3dude:

Will it play games?

There will probably be a new standard, or it may include DirectX support.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Fat Cookies:

If it is Linux based then its very good for current Linux users because Google have the financial backing to get good developers to make stuff for Linux. However it will probably be locked to Chrome OS.

All the apps will be web based, and therefore work on any system.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @The_Flames The_Flames
item.description:
@The_Flames wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:287855”][quote author=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/8139711.stm]
“Speed, simplicity and security are the key aspects of Google Chrome OS,” the firm said in its official blog.

The operating system, which will run on an open source licence, was a “natural extension” of its Chrome browser, the firm said. [/quote]

"We are completely redesigning the underlying security architecture of the OS so that users don’t have to deal with viruses, malware and security updates.

“It should just work,” said Google.

Sounds like they are going to use linux to me, which would make sense as they use it for Android. Awesome. :D[/quote]

Yeah they’re using Linux, they said so in their blog:

http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2009/07/introducing-google-chrome-os.html:

Google Chrome running within a new windowing system on top of a Linux kernel.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Saw that yesterday, pretty interesting. Microsoft is making an announcement to “get back” at them on Monday… probably 7 going RTM or news on their new browser Gazelle. And according to one of the sources I saw it is going to be linux based.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If it is not Linux based it will be near useless.
If it is Linux based then its very good for current Linux users because Google have the financial backing to get good developers to make stuff for Linux. However it will probably be locked to Chrome OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Operating System
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/8139711.stm"]"Speed, simplicity and security are the key aspects of Google Chrome OS,” the firm said in its official blog.

The operating system, which will run on an open source licence, was a “natural extension” of its Chrome browser, the firm said.[/quote]

[quote="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/8139711.stm"]"We are completely redesigning the underlying security architecture of the OS so that users don’t have to deal with viruses, malware and security updates.

“It should just work,” said Google.[/quote]

Sounds like they are going to use linux to me, which would make sense as they use it for Android. Awesome.

Read full topic
